There are two broad categories of naming to consider: descriptive names and creative, or “branded,” names. Descriptive names are, well, descriptive – the product or feature name says what the product is or does. Creative names are pretty much the exact opposite. They might have some tangential relationship with what a product or feature does, but they are not explanatory by themselves. Think of Microsoft XBox, for example. Just by hearing the name you wouldn’t know that it is a video game console.

Any product name which is the same or similar either in writing/ pronunciation, with the product name of an adulterated product is prohibited. Product name may be included together with the brand name or trademark name, if applicable.
